title: Sliske

properties.name: description
properties.value: Sliske is a mysterious Zarosian Mahjarrat responsible for giving the Barrows Brothers their equipment and subsequently raising them as undead wights. He is referred to as "Sliske the serpent-tongued, who delves the shadows" by Azzanadra in the 20th Postbag from the Hedge[1] and appears as a mysterious figure in the crumbling tome.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Sliske
Sliske depicted as a shadow behind Guthan.

Sliske is a mysterious Zarosian Mahjarrat responsible for giving the Barrows Brothers their equipment and subsequently raising them as undead wights. He is referred to as "Sliske the serpent-tongued, who delves the shadows" by Azzanadra in the 20th Postbag from the Hedge[1] and appears as a mysterious figure in the crumbling tome.

Sliske was the one who tricked Ashuelot Reis and her comrades to freeing Nex from the slumber.[2]

Barrows brothers[edit | edit source]

Sliske got involved with six Misthalin small town brothers, now known as the Barrows brothers, by making a pact with them, in which he would supply them with powerful artefacts and arcane knowledge.[3] In return, the brothers had to serve him once they were worthy.[4].

Sliske's given armor and weapons made the brothers incredibly powerful, but this would ultimately lead to their doom. By the time the Morytania Campaign started, the brothers were near invincible, annihilating the enemy, all while Sliske was secretly watching over his later-to-be servants.

Once he deemed them worthy, he visited the camp and told the brothers that the time had come to fulfill their side of the pact, to die and become mighty Zarosian warriors. [5]. Upon hearing this, the brothers were weakened, and as the campaign pushed onward, their strength waned until at last even the mighty six fell to the enemy.[6] The comrades of the six buried them into the barrows and returned to their homeland, unable to advance without the mighty six.[7]

After the burial of the brothers, Sliske cast an ancient necromancy spell to animate their lifeless bodies to serve his god, Zaros. The brothers now reside as half-living bodies, summoned with rage and power to kill anyone that might disturb the peace.[8]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 20 - "Transcript:Tales from earlier ages", letter 3, by Azzanadra. RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "Before I was imprisoned there were many of us, the most powerful of which you have named - but do not forget Sliske the serpent-tongued, who delves the shadows, and the impostor Zamorak, who calls himself a god."
  2. ↑ https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Transcript:Ashuelot_Reis
  3. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "His long years had taken him to many distant lands where he had collected much arcane knowledge and many artefacts of value and strength, and it was those very weapons and armours he had given them, that they now wielded, which granted them their desire."
  4. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "The time has come, my warriors. The gifts I bestowed upon you have served you well, and you, in turn, have served your god. Now, it is time to begin your servitude to me...to my god."
  5. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "The time has come, my warriors. The gifts I bestowed upon you have served you well, and you, in turn, have served your god. Now, it is time to begin your servitude to me...to my god."
  6. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "but much as the sun above giving way to night, so too was their fate inevitable. As the last rays of light failed, so too did the brothers and the campaign with them."
  7. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "For six days, the survivors dug up the earth and built crypts for the brothers;"
  8. ↑ The Fall of Six, Old School RuneScape. "Arms outstretched atop the central mound, the stranger chanted in some foul, ancient language, casting his old magic. A vulgar purple light formed in front of him, fell to the earth, and bled into each of the barrows."
